instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 3 beeps
threads.message: have got an 820-3332 that beeps 3 times. The 1.5V memory power rail is present ... I did s slight reflow of the RAM chips but still the same , do I need to replace all the ram chips or could it be the PCH? please help guys .. thanks in advance.

threads.title: 820-3332 3 beeps
threads.message:
DDR lines go to CPU, not PCH.
You can try to reball all RAM chips, but could be waste of time.
Possibly broken trace, or CPU issue...

threads.title: 820-3332 3 beeps
threads.message: Reflow RAM and pray. Looks like you already did, so probably trash.

threads.title: 820-3332 3 beeps
threads.message: Thank you all for taking your time
